comments:
Build ID:  I20070621-1340

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Use Eclipse normally
2.Edit a XSLT file with Oxygen
3.A dialog says that there is a problem with SWT and asks me if I want to quit the app.


More information:
It has happened me 3 times in 2 days.
It didn't use to happen with Eclipse 3.2.

Probably it has to do with the new text drag and drop support.
Notified also the Oxygen developers in its forum.
It is always reproducible in my environment.

You need to use the Oxygen 8.2 version of the plugin that is compatible with Eclipse 3.3.  Oxygen 7.2 won't work.

http://www.oxygenxml.com/download.html

I installed Oxygen 8.2 and opened an EmployeeString example (.xls) file and it appeared to open without errors.

I don't have Windows 2003 Server so I tested on WinXP. Does the problem only happen on Windows 2003 Server?

(In reply to comment #5)
> I installed Oxygen 8.2 and opened an EmployeeString example (.xls) file and it
> appeared to open without errors.
> 
> I don't have Windows 2003 Server so I tested on WinXP. Does the problem only
> happen on Windows 2003 Server?
> 

No this happened on any platform with Oxygen 8.2 or prior that wasn't made for Eclipse 3.3.  I experience it both on Windows and Linux.
